Articles.Content:
I managed to rescue a Kerbal today from LKO.

I have been playing career (on Normal but with no starting funds) and finally got a Mun Flyby mission and used the science to get the Skipper Engines.

Then I got two rescue contracts and thought yeah lets do this. Although I have never tried a rendezvous nor even a close landing before.

I don't have RCS unlocked and forgot to tell Jeb to stop doing SAS so I had two orbits with no reaction wheels. I built big and managed to get 5 FLT-800s with LVT 909s in space with 3 Capsules on.

So I managed to rendezvous taking about 3 hours realtime but about 3 days from mission launch.

It is so satisfying to manage it, even though I think it was more luck than judgment.

Got another to save on a similar orbit so hope I can grab her aswell.

I have had KSP a while, got it on steam before 0.90 but cannot remember when I started (it did have all planets/moons though) and picked it up/put it down here and there but am having a lot of fun and frustration with the Career mode.

Congratz! 

Rendezvous are one of the hardest things to figure out when you're just starting out on the game and they are also good training for interplanetary travel as well. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
